blogPosts.content:
So far, I think that the Docusaurus platform has been nice... I'm still trying to understand the ```ts
{content}
``` I know that it's the structure of the whole page - but want to figure out how to edit things. :::tip Overall, I found that these few things were something had helped me get started with Docusaurus: > 1. The [Docusaurus Tutorial](https://docusaurus.io/docs/tutorial/create-a-page) was a great place to start > 2. The [Docusaurus Docs](https://docusaurus.io/docs/intro) were a great resource for learning more about Docusaurus > 3. The [Docusaurus GitHub Repo](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus) was a great resource for learning more about the Docusaurus codebase :::

tags.label: Portfolio
tags.description: Posts about portfolio development and updates

blogPosts.content:
Welcome to my new portfolio blog! ðŸŽ‰

I've recently migrated my portfolio from a custom Vite + React setup to Docusaurus, and I'm excited about the possibilities this opens up.

<!-- truncate -->

## Why Docusaurus?

After working with a custom portfolio setup, I decided to migrate to Docusaurus for several reasons:

1. **Built-in blog functionality** - Perfect for sharing thoughts and project updates
2. **MDX support** - I can embed React components directly in my blog posts
3. **SEO optimization** - Static site generation with excellent search engine optimization
4. **TypeScript support** - Full TypeScript integration out of the box
5. **Customization** - Still flexible enough to create custom components and layouts

## What's Next?

I'll be using this blog to share:
- Project updates and releases
- Technical insights and tutorials
- Thoughts on software engineering and computer science
- Academic journey at Northeastern University

Stay tuned for more content! ðŸš€
